item.title: Sezzle 自 2023 年触底以来已上涨 7000%。问题是为什么
item.description: 通常情况下，当一只股票在不到两年的时间里飙升超过 7000% 时，投资者都会知道其中的原因。但 Sezzle Inc.【原文：Usually when a stock soars more than 7,000% in less than two years, investors have some idea why. Then there’s the curious case of Sezzle Inc.】

item.title: JLR 母公司回击特朗普批评，坚持有争议的捷豹品牌重塑
item.description: 捷豹路虎的下一任首席执行官回避了美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的批评，坚称汽车制造商状况良好，客户对两极分化的捷豹品牌重塑反应积极。【原文：Jaguar Land Rover’s next chief executive officer shook off criticism from US President Donald Trump, insisting the carmaker is in good shape with customers responding positively to the polarizing Jaguar rebrand.】

item.title: 关税开始挤压热爱特朗普的农民的利润
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统曾多次表示他热爱农民。然而，他的行动正在整个农业行业激起波澜，因为关税提高了从拖拉机到化肥等一切产品的成本，并挤压了已经在与低作物价格作斗争的美国种植者的利润。【原文：President Donald Trump has repeatedly said he loves farmers. His actions, though, are rippling across the agriculture industry as tariffs raise the cost of everything from tractors to fertilizers and squeeze profits for US growers already contending with low crop prices.】

item.title: 亚马逊阴影笼罩，交易台情绪崩溃
item.description: Trade Desk Inc.的分析师越来越担心该公司的广告技术会被亚马逊公司的产品所取代，因而放弃了对这家曾经的市场宠儿的投资。【原文：Trade Desk Inc. analysts are bailing on the one-time market favorite amid growing fears that its advertising technology will get steamrolled by Amazon.com Inc.’s offerings】

item.title: 面对特朗普的威胁，卡尼正在修补与墨西哥的关系
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）在计划对北美自由贸易协定进行审查之前用美国的惩罚性关税威胁其邻国，加拿大正努力重塑与墨西哥的关系。【原文：Canada is working to reset its ties with Mexico as Donald Trump threatens his neighbors with punishing US tariffs ahead of a planned review of the North American free-trade pact.】

item.title: 美国股市走高，科技公司助推涨势
item.description: 美国股市在本周最后一个交易日收涨，投资者在此期间收到了一系列财报和关税更新。【原文：US stocks posted gains to kick off the last session of a week during which investors received a slew of earnings reports and tariff updates.】

item.title: 特朗普时代的监管者将在下一场加密货币与银行之争中扮演关键角色
item.description: 加密货币公司与传统贷款机构之间关于利息和银行特许权申请的一场大战，即将由唐纳德-特朗普总统任命的监管机构做出决定，而特朗普一直是数字货币的积极支持者。【原文：A major battle between crypto firms and traditional lenders over interest and bank charter applications is poised to be decided by regulators appointed by President Donald Trump, who has been a vocal supporter of digital currencies.】

item.title: 洛杉矶地区大火持续燃烧一周，造成数千英亩土地焚毁
item.description: 洛杉矶西北部的一场大火已经烧毁了近 10 万英亩的土地，数百名居民在干燥的环境和强风的炙烤下四处逃命。【原文：A fire northwest of Los Angles has consumed nearly 100,000 acres and sent hundreds of residents fleeing for their lives as dry conditions and strong winds fan the flames.】

item.title: 私募股权投资对散户投资者的追求令养老金和捐赠基金感到不安
item.description: 一些全球最大的私募股权投资者担心，随着成千上万的散户投资者被邀请进入这个原本只属于成熟客户的资产类别，他们可能会失去自己的特殊地位。【原文：Some of the world’s biggest investors in private equity are worried they could lose their special status as thousands of retail investors get invited into an asset class that had been reserved for sophisticated clients.】

item.title: 埃及放弃数百万桶石油转而使用液化天然气
item.description: 埃及在获得大量液化天然气帮助满足其发电需求之后，放弃了在以色列天然气供应短暂中断时提出购买的 200 多万桶石油货物。【原文：Egypt gave up on more than 2 million barrels of petroleum cargoes it offered to buy when gas supplies from Israel were briefly cut, after securing massive amounts of LNG to help meet its electricity generation needs.】

item.title: 糖价因担忧巴西最大种植国甘蔗产量而上涨
item.description: 由于担心最大的种植国巴西甘蔗产量下降，原糖期货四天来首次上涨。【原文：Raw sugar futures advanced for the first time in four days on concern over weaker cane yields in the biggest grower, Brazil.】

item.title: 铀出口国纳米比亚申请加入核供应国集团
item.description: 纳米比亚已批准该国加入核供应国集团的申请，该集团是一个全球性机构，负责制定核技术和核材料出口规则，以防止核技术和核材料被用于武器。【原文：Namibia has approved the country’s bid to join the Nuclear Suppliers Group, a global body that develops rules on the export of nuclear technology and materials to prevent its use in weapons.】

item.title: 英国央行皮尔警告季度降息步伐存疑
item.description: 英格兰银行首席经济学家休-皮尔（Huw Pill）警告说，在通胀重新抬头并有可能改变家庭和企业行为之后，央行可能需要放慢每季度一次的降息步伐。【原文：Bank of England Chief Economist Huw Pill warned the central bank may need to slow its once-a-quarter pace of interest-rate cuts after a resurgence in inflation that risks changing the behavior of households and businesses.】

item.title: 招聘结果显示，前景艰难，绿芽初露
item.description: 欧洲和美国的招聘公司在经历了年初的惨淡经营后，在第二季度出现了微弱的企稳迹象。要想扭转颓势，仍有赖于下半年的大幅改善。【原文：Recruiters across Europe and the US showed timid signs of stabilization in the second quarter after a dismal start to the year. Any reversal of fortunes still hinges on a drastic improvement in the second half.】

item.title: 加拿大意外裁员 4.08 万人，创大流行病以来之最
item.description: 自 2022 年 1 月以来，加拿大经济失去的工作岗位最多，除大流行病外，这是七年来最大的降幅。【原文：The Canadian economy lost the most jobs since January 2022, and excluding the pandemic, it’s the largest drop in seven years.】

item.title: 降息后智利年度通胀意外加快
item.description: 在智利央行表示将在未来几个季度逐步降低借贷成本之后，智利的年度通胀率自 3 月份以来首次出人意料地加速上升。【原文：Chile’s annual inflation unexpectedly accelerated for the first time since March after the central bank signaled it will gradually lower its borrowing costs over coming quarters.】

item.title: 罗马尼亚维持利率不变，增税将加剧通货膨胀
item.description: 罗马尼亚央行维持利率不变，因为该国正在为一系列旨在遏制预算赤字的增税措施带来的通胀激增做准备。【原文：Romania’s central bank kept interest rates unchanged as the country braces for an inflation surge from a series of tax hikes designed to curb the budget deficit.】

item.title: 拥有人工智能故事的绿色科技公司财源滚滚
item.description:
随着数据中心开发商寻求能够为人工智能提供全天候电力的无碳资源，长期以来备受冷落的核能和地热资源正受到热捧。【原文：

Long-unloved nuclear and geothermal are experiencing a boom in interest as data center developers seek carbon-free resources capable of delivering round-the-clock electricity to power artificial intelligence.

】

item.title: 重油产量回升，美国炼油商看好利润率
item.description: 随着加拿大和中东产量的回升，美国炼油厂盈利能力的一个关键驱动因素--以低价购买重质原油的能力--将在下半年得到改善。【原文：A key driver of US refiners’ profitability — the ability to buy heavy crude at cheap prices — is set to improve in the second half of the year as Canadian and Middle Eastern production rebounds.】

item.title: 特朗普力图遏制印度对俄罗斯石油的需求，但也存在风险
item.description:
如果市场紧缩，华盛顿的赌局就很难在没有价格冲击的情况下取得成功。【原文：

A tighter market would make it far harder for Washington’s gambit to succeed without a price shock.

】

item.title: 华尔街和人工智能初创公司正在争夺入门级研究人员
item.description: 在曼哈顿下东区的一个屋顶酒吧里，大约 150 名量子研究人员与人工智能初创公司 Anthropic 的员工会面，后者恳请他们考虑远离华尔街的生活。【原文：At a rooftop bar on Manhattan’s Lower East Side, roughly 150 quant researchers met with employees at the artificial-intelligence startup Anthropic who implored them to consider a life away from Wall Street.】

item.title: 刚果和平可能预示着与美国公司达成价值 7 亿美元的电力交易
item.description: Symbion 电力有限责任公司提议，如果刚果民主共和国和卢旺达能够执行最近由美国支持的和平协议，将在两国边境建造一座 140 兆瓦的发电厂和输电线路。【原文：Symbion Power LLC is proposing a 140-megawatt power plant and transmission lines along the border of Democratic Republic of Congo and Rwanda if the two countries can implement a recent US-backed peace agreement.】

item.title: 印度批准向液化石油气补贴销售企业提供 34 亿美元援助
item.description: 印度内阁周五批准向国营燃料零售商一次性支付 3,000 亿卢比（约合 34 亿美元），以补偿他们以补贴价格向贫困家庭出售液化石油气。【原文：India’s cabinet on Friday approved a one-time payout of 300 billion rupees ($3.4 billion) for state-run fuel retailers to compensate them for selling liquefied petroleum gas to poor households at subsidized rates.】

item.title: 在无人驾驶汽车投资问题上，优步（Uber）走在让股东满意的起跑线上
item.description: 欢迎收看《深度科技》（Tech In Depth），这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日通讯。今天，Natalie Lung 报道 Uber 投资未来机器人出租车的战略。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Natalie Lung reports on Uber’s strategy to invest in the future of robotaxis.】

item.title: 美国贸易从布雷顿森林体系转向 "特恩伯里体系
item.description: 我是马尔科姆-斯科特，驻悉尼的国际经济编辑。今天，我们来看看美国贸易代表对特朗普关税的看法。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Malcolm Scott, international economics editor in Sydney. item.description:

item.title: 梅西、米莱和米老鼠吸引阿根廷游客赴美旅游
item.description: 弗朗西斯科-冈萨雷斯-加莱（Francisco González Galé）没想到，今年早些时候，当他实现孩子们的愿望，从布宜诺斯艾利斯前往奥兰多迪斯尼世界时，会有一种宾至如归的感觉。这位 46 岁的阿根廷律师过去每隔几年就会飞往美国一次，但在 2025 年，他已经去过美国两次了。【原文：Francisco González Galé didn’t expect to feel so at home when he fulfilled his kids’ wishes earlier this year by traveling to Walt Disney World in Orlando from Buenos Aires. The 46-year-old Argentine lawyer used to fly to the US once every couple of years, but he’s already been stateside twice in 2025.】

item.title: Glencore 调整交易团队，煤炭主管将离职
item.description: 嘉能可集团（Glencore Plc）庞大的煤炭交易业务主管即将离职，这是该公司交易部门多年来最大的一次调整。【原文：The head of Glencore Plc’s huge coal-trading operation is leaving in the biggest shake-up of the company’s trading unit in years.】

item.title: 摩根大通称米兰联储人选可能导致国债曲线陡峭化
item.description: 摩根大通银行（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：The US Treasury curve could steepen from its widest level in four years if President Donald Trump succeeds in making a key appointment to the Federal Reserve, according to strategists at JPMorgan Chase & Co.】

item.title: 普利司通计划在美国和欧洲实现增长以抵消巴西的损失
item.description: 普利司通公司（Bridgestone Corp.）计划通过重振其百年品牌凡士通（Firestone）和提高北美产量来抵消巴西市场的亏损，从而在关税压力下提高在美国和欧洲的销量。【原文：Bridgestone Corp. plans to offset losses in Brazil by revitalizing its century-old Firestone brand and boosting North American production in a campaign to ramp up sales in the US and Europe amid tariff pressures.】
